newsitem.title: UK: Morgan Stanley launches Europe technology index.
newsitem.headline: Morgan Stanley launches Europe technology index.

text.p: Morgan Stanley said on Monday it had launched a European technology index called the EuroTec index MSEUR.

It said it was launching the index to satisfy interest in the market for a liquid technology investment vehicle, and said that due to strong performance and increasing interest, discussions were under way on launching listed derivative products of the back of the index.

"It provides a relevant benchmark for measuring the performance of specific technology stocks and technology funds and to compare the European technology sector against other indices," Morgan Stanley said.
It could also be used as a basis for implementing investment strategies such as hedging, sector rotation and leveraged exposure, it said.

The index comprises 20 companies representing technology industry segments ranging from computer services to semiconductor capital equipment. They represent over $200 billion in market capitalisation.
From June 21, 1996 to date, the Eurotec index has risen 88 percent against 54 percent for the Morgan Stanley High-Tech 35 Index and 34 percent for the MSCI Europe.

The companies included in the equally weighted index are Ericsson, Siemens, Philips Electronics, Alcatel Alsthom, Nokia, SAP, SGS-THOMSON, Baan Company, ASM Lithography, Cap Gemini, Dassault Systems, Getronics, Sema Group, Misys, CMG, WM-Data, Sage Group, Axime, TT Tieto and Logica.
